body.name: AsiaHorse VE-HUB 2IN1 ARGB/PWM hub Used SATA Power Supply,9 Ports for Addressable RGB Lighting with 9 Port PWM (Black)
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Sunday, February 18 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 10 hrs 6 mins
features: Asiahorse addressable argb controller adopts 2 in 1 designs to connect PWM and ARGB cables, which can effectively sort out the layout of intricate wiring and make chassis wiring more convenient and concise.
This 3-pin pwm fan hub can simultaneously expand any 5V addressable RGB product while occupying only one RGB connector on the motherboard, freeing up more ports for other devices.

With the ability to connect up to 9 PWM fans simultaneously on one side port for speed control, you can optimize the cooling capacity within the extended chassis and enjoy higher system performance. (Red PWM port must be connected first in the Hub)
And another 9 ports can connect 5V ARGB LED devices for simultaneous 5V 3pin LED Argb-Control, you can optimally extend the Light function within the chassis and enjoy excellent visual effects.

Note: The rgb fan controller is Only compatible with 3pin 5V addressable RGB headers or controllers. Please Do Not connect to 12V RGB components, making sure the arrows on connectors and headers line up.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.1 4.1 out of 5 stars 189 ratings 4.1 out of 5 stars

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: SYNC/PWM Data cable with braided mesh sleeve 9-hole connection 9 pwm and 9 sync interfaces can greatly satisfy your rgb desire Data read The red data hole is responsible for the data reading of the speed, so it needs to be accessed first.

Note 1. Supports the maximum power: 32.4W 2. Each port can control up to 180 total RGB LEDS for spectacular system, but if the argb hub connect 9 argb fan at the same time, each port only support 120 RGB LEDS. 3. The pc fan hub can directly connect the daisy-chain fans, only the RGB LEDS don't exceed 120pcs. 4. Compatible with all RGB fans and RGB components which use 5v 3-pin header.

Easy to Install Mark Velcro zone and connection markings on the back Velcro Velcro can be more convenient to disassemble your limit box Hidden in your corner Very light size, can be easily installed in your case.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Compact, magnetic, easy to install, and supports up to 9 RGB Fans!
reviews.reviewText: The texture and logo give it a cool an edgy look. It's compact. It does exactly what I hoped it did... power all of my fans. Easy to install and, to my surprise, the bottom is magnetic so it can stick to the frame or inside the rear cover of the tower. I didn't need the provided Velcro strips. This is a must if you are going to use more than 3 rgb fans in your build.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Great price. Reputable manufacturer. Good reviews. Fast shipping and well packaged. Pleased with product. I would recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works Great, Buying Another As Gift
reviews.reviewText: Great fan controller. Small as can be for everything that plugs in it. Easy to use; you will have a hard time figuring out how to take care of all the cables though to keep a clean case.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great product with wonky connection tolerances.
reviews.reviewText: Overall I like the product. It does what it advertises. It supports up to 9 PWM Fans and up to 9 5v ARGB devices. It "feels" light and possibly flimsy but actually it's construction is pretty solid. This hub is the best option to control the speed of multiple (together not individually) and addressable lighting with your motherboard's default software. This will not work with fans like Corsair or Liang Li's Uni fans that have a proprietary connectors. I'm using it with 7 Fractal Design Prisma fans and it's wonderful only using AuraSync to control everything.I only have 3 minor issues with the product. Neither of them I feel are deal breakers.1) The PWM sockets are super tight. It requires a lot more force than one would think to be necessary to unplug a fan. I was afraid of stripping the fan wires from the connectors stuck in the hub. Adversely, the RGB sockets are incrediblely loose.2) The PWM / ARGB signal-in cable at first was not receiving the RGB signal from the motherboard (PWM signal was fine). Even though that lead in to the hub had snapped in, the connection was not tight enough. Once again I had to apply more force to get it work.3) Would have been nicer if it had a magnetic strip than Velcro.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Cheap and Breaks Easily
reviews.reviewText: Installed this in my build and immediately I could tell there were issues. My fans powered up no problem but the RGB on some fans flickered. Installed the ASUS RGB management software and the hub was not recognized. The RGB of the fans stopped working a day later.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Works great, but tolerance issues exist
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Once you get it to work, this product works as advertised. It connects your 3 pin RGB devices and 4 pin PWM fan power cords in one place which is useful if you only have a single addressable RGB header on your motherboard. It can even accept some daisy-chaining; I have four of the fans daisy-chained together and fed into one RGB port (those were power connected by MOLEX though in a separate configuration directly to the power supply, so you would probably need to actually connect the fans individually to the PWM ports for power).The tolerances are a bit tight on the PWM side and too loose on the RGB side. The worst tolerance though is the SATA connector. Plugging it in gives the peripherals power without any issue, but the data side where the RGB info is transferred just does not fit well with your standard SATA connection. It requires a LOT of force on the SATA connector in order for the hub to recognize the RGB. I would sometimes find that the connection would come loose and all the RGB disappears since that part of the SATA connection would no longer be recognized by the hub.Ultimately what made it work consistently was adding a large zip-tie shown (and tying it very tight) across the length of the hub to securely hold the SATA connector to the hub.It works great though with their RGB strips though, you could either daisy-chain them together or use a splitter to feed into the hub. My motherboard is an ASRock X570 Taichi and the hub is Polychrome Sync compatible, which is nice.Overall, I would recommend this once they fix some of the tolerance issues.Edit: After a month of use, I can't consistently get the RGB half of the SATA connector to stay connected, even using the zip-tie workaround. It would blink on and off at times, forcing me to fiddle with the SATA connection until it lights up again. Dropping a star as a result :(

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Does the job
reviews.reviewText: This has been my goto all-in-one fan hub/controller. Easy to install. I've never had any issues with these and use them several times a year. Works with Corsair Icue and MSI Mystic Light.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Better than others I have tried.
El velcro es muy fuerte aunque los acabados no se ven tan premium igual es algo que no está a la vista
